fields.description:
GroupByOperator holds onto the Hash aggregates accumulated when the plan is cached.

Drop the hashAggregates in case of error during forwarding to the next operator.

Added for PTF, TopN and all GroupBy cases.
fields.summary: GroupByOperator: Drop the hash aggregates when closing operator

comments.body:
[~wyukawa]: take a look at this patch for your Tez OOM issue.

My primary suspect is that you need HIVE-10529 to fix that issue, but to confirm this issue or the other - you need to confirm that this issue goes away when you do

hive --hiveconf tez.am.container.reuse.enabled=false;

(note, has to be in the cli --hiveconf, doing set in CLI doesn't work)

Thank you for your comment.

But I switch to Hive on MapReduce in production environment, so now it's difficult to test.

Here are the results of testing the latest attachment:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12792174/HIVE-13240.1.patch

{color:red}ERROR:{color} -1 due to no test(s) being added or modified.

{color:red}ERROR:{color} -1 due to 1921 failed/errored test(s), 9206 tests executed
*Failed tests:*
{noformat}
